content.question: Assume a profit-maximizing monopolist is able to price discriminate, dividing its consumers into two distinct groups charging each a different price. Based on this information, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The monopolist would earn greater profit charging each consumer the same price, not charging two different prices.
The price discrimination can only be successful if one group can resell the product but the other group cannot.
The group with the more elastic demand will pay the lower price.
The consumers with less willingness to pay will pay the higher price.
The group with greater production costs will pay a lower price.

content.answer: The group with the more elastic demand will pay the lower price.
